subject: Do you want to learn Test Automation using Perl?
header: Perl Maven is known for best collection of articles. Recently I came across one such, "Test Automation using Perl screencasts". If you want to learn more about it then I would highly recommend it. For more information, please visit page.
Please do let us know how you find it, till then enjoy the week.

entries.title: Simplicity made easy
entries.author: damian_conway
entries.text: Damian insights into the Perl Weekly Challenge has been greatly appreciated and discussed. You wouldn't want to miss his points here.

entries.title: diff-so-fancy v1.2.6
entries.author: dean_hamstead
entries.text: diff-so-fancy strives to make your diffs human readable instead of machine readable. This helps improve code quality and helps you spot defects faster.

entries.title: TPC:iP Thank You for Coming
entries.author: shawn_carroll
entries.text: The organizers of TPCiP want to thank all who attended, volunteered, presented, or sponsored us! Even if you are just following along on Twitter or subscribed to our YouTube channel - thanks for supporting Perl!

entries.text: Read about the journey of Perl Weekly Challenge on the occassion of completing 3 months.

chapters.title: Perl Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Perl Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out from your comfort-zone.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. We now pick one random member as winner from the list of participated members every week. You can increase your chance to win the prize money of $50 Amazaon voucher by submitting solutions to all the challenges as well as blog about it. The Weekly prize money is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers. For more information, please read FAQ page.

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
